Light.Description: Generic light for Aircraft and Helicopters
Generic Anti collision light - normally red flashing
Anti-collision found on bottom of the fuselage
Anti-collision found on bottom of the fuselage in NVG mode
Anti-collision found on Top of the fuselage
Anti-collision found on Top of the fuselage in NVG mode
White flood lights used to illuminate the ground or part of the aircraft
Head light used to allow pilots to see ahead
Strobe lights used in flight to indicate position
Red Strobe lights used in flight to indicate position
White Strobe lights used in flight to indicate position
Infrared Lights used to indicate position using infrared instruments
White lights used on Landing approach
Lights used in flight to indicate position
Red Navigation light found on the left wing
Flashing Red Navigation light found on the left wing
Green Navigation light found on the right wing
Flashing Green Navigation light found on the right wing
White Navigation light found on the tail wing
Flashing White Navigation light found on the tail wing
Navigation light used in NVG mode
Flood light used to illuminated the tail, showing off the logo or markings
White lights used when Aircrafts taxi on the ground
Red Obstruction light found on left wing
Green Obstruction light found on right wing
Search Light used in NVG Mode
Green light Aft of Starboard pod
Red light Aft of Starboard pod
Yellow light Aft of Starboard pod

Yellow aldus light at Port Aft door
Light used to Illuminate objects carried on a slung load
Lower White on bottom of Aft pylon near exhaust
Specific military Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) lights
Lights used in flight to indicate position
Red navigation light found on left wing
Green navigation light found on right wing
White navigation light usually on the tail
White lights that indicate a vehicle backing up
Yellow flashing emergency lights (i.e. 4-way flashing indicator light
Red lights when brakes are applied
Primary lights on a vehicle that allow a driver to see ahead
Caboose red light at rear of a train
Search Light used in NVG Mode
Lights used to illuminate the anchor
Lights used to illuminate the ground or the deck
Lights found on a mast of the civilian ship
Lights used to illuminate the ground or the deck
Generic lights found on a mast of the military ship
Horizon Bar lights for landing on ship
Deck light indicating the presence of an object which is dangerous to an aircraft
Light indicating the authority for flying operations to the Flight Deck Officer or Pilot
Lights used to illuminate the ground or the deck
Used to identify the vessel to an approaching aircraft
Stabilized Glide Slope Indicator (approach light indicator)
A means of indicating an aircraft to be at standby
A means of indicating to approaching aircraft that recovery is not permitted and should be aborted immediately.
Light created by tracer fire effect in a bullet
Flare defensive counter measure light effect (vs. IR guided missile)
Chaff defensive counter measure light effect (vs. Radar guided missiles)
Regroups all lights that could be assigned to (mainly human) lifeforms
Survivor specific lights (on ground or sea)
Lights used to illuminate the ground
A light indicating the presence of an object which is dangerous to an aircraft in flight.
Flashing Ground light that helps to indicate position
Flashing Red rail road crossing stop lights
White light indicating the presence of an hazard around the airport
Generic Line based lights (Linear features as Roads)
Generic Multi-lane divided highway specific lights
Generic Area lights which cover a larger area
Apron entrance light from runway or taxiway
Flood light to illuminate the Apron
Double peak White 2 sec interval Rotating Beacon
Double peak White 3 sec interval Rotating Beacon
Double peak White 5 sec interval Rotating Beacon
Double peak White 10 sec interval Rotating Beacon
Double peak White 2 sec interval Flashing Beacon

Double peak White 10 sec interval Flashing Beacon
Red light indicating the presence of an object which is dangerous to an aircraft in flight.
Circling Guidance Light which helps on a circling approach
Marking Lights that illuminate any markings that need to be visible on the runway in low visibility
Generic Precision approach path indicator. Provides visual glide slope indication using a single row of two or four light units.
Abbreviated Precision Approach Path Indicator closest to runway
Abbreviated Precision Approach Path Indicator farthest to runway

T-VASIS Fly-up 2 (closest to Wing Bar) for 2.5 degree Glide slope
T-VASIS Fly-up 3 (farthest to Wing Bar) for 2.5 degree Glide slope

Light which indicated runway over run area
Runway threshold lights: used to identify the landing threshold of the runway
Touchdown Zone lights: used to identify the appropriate landing area on the runway after the threshold
Land and hold Short Operations light: runway intersecting stop lights
Apron Entrance light which indication area where taxi enters apron area
Aligned light for a straight sequence of a taxiway
Curved lights for a curved sequence of a taxiway
Generic Taxiway high speed area lights
Clearance bar lights are located at hold short positions on taxiways in order to increase the visibility of holding position locations. They consist of three yellow lights.
Generic RGl (Runway Guard Light) is used to enhance the visibility of taxiway holding positions on an airport
Windsock light used to illuminate the windsock in poor visibility
Heliport Approach Landing Marking Green light
Heliport Approach Landing Marking Red light
Heliport Approach Landing Marking Amber light
